verses.verse: {A List of Those who Returned} {(Nehemiah 7:6-73)} d Here is a list {Cf. Neh 7:6} of descendants of the province of Judah {The Heb. lacks of Judah} who returned from the captivity, from those who had been exiled. Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, had taken them to Babylon. They came back to Jerusalem and Judah, each one to his town,

along with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, {MT of Neh 7:7 lacks Seraiah, Reelaiah} Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, {Cf. Neh 7:7 Mispereth} Bigvai, Rehum, {Cf. Neh 7:7 Nehum} and Baanah. Here is the enumeration of: The Men of Israel:
Descendants of {Lit. Sons of ; and so throughout the chapter} Parosh: 2172
Descendants of Shephatiah: 372
Descendants of Arah: 775 {Cf. Neh 7:10 652}
Descendants of Pahath-moab; that is, through Jeshua and Joab: 2812 {Cf. Neh 7:11 2818}
Descendants of Elam: 1254
Descendants of Zattu: 945 {Cf. Neh 7:13 845}
Descendants of Zaccai: 760
Descendants of Bani: {Cf. Neh 7:13 Binnui} 642 {Cf. Neh 7:13 648}
Descendants of Bebai: 623 {Cf. Neh 7:16 628}
Descendants of Azgad: 1222 {Cf. Neh 7:17 2322}
Descendants of Adonikam: 666 {Cf. Neh 7:18 667}
Descendants of Bigvai: 256 {Cf. Neh 7:19 267}
Descendants of Adin: 454 {Cf. Neh 7:20 655}
Descendants of Ater through Hezekiah: 98
Descendants of Bezai: 323 {Cf. Neh 7:22 328}
Descendants of Jorah: {Cf. Neh 7:24 Hariph} 112
Descendants of Hashum: 223 {Cf. Neh 7:22 328}
Descendants of Gibbar: {Cf. Neh 7:25 Gibeon} 95
Descendants of exiles from {The Heb. lacks exiles from ; and so through v. 35} Bethlehem: 123
People from {Lit. Men of ; and so in vv. 23, 27, and 28} Netophah: 56 {Cf. Neh 7:26, where the combined total is 188}
People from Anathoth: 128
Descendants of exiles from Azmaveth: {Cf. Neh 7:28 Beth-azmaveth} 42
Descendants of exiles from Kiriath-arim; {Cf. Neh 7:29 Kiriath-jearim} that is, Chephirah and Beeroth: 743
Descendants of exiles from Ramah and Geba: 621
People from Michmas: 122
People from Bethel and Ai: 223 {Cf. Neh 7:32 123}
Descendants of exiles from Nebo: 52
Descendants of exiles from Magbish: 156
Descendants of exiles from the other Elam: 1254
Descendants of exiles from Harim: 320
Descendants of exiles from Lod, Hadid, and Ono: 725 {Cf. Neh 7:37 721}
Descendants of exiles from Jericho: 345
Descendants of exiles from Senaah: 3630 {Cf. Neh 7:38 3930}
The Priests: Descendants of Jedaiah from the household of Jeshua: 973
Descendants of Immer: 152
Descendants of Pashhur: 1247
Descendants of Harim: 117
The Descendants of Levi: Descendants of Jeshua and Kadmiel; that is, descendants of Hodaviah: {Cf. Neh 7:43 Hodevah} 74
The Singers: Descendants of Asaph: 128 {Cf. Neh 7:44 148}
The Descendants of the Gatekeepers: Descendants of Shallum, Ater, Talmon, Akkub, Hatita, and Shobai, totaling: 139 {Cf. Neh 7:45 138}

The Temple Servants: {Heb. Nethinim ; i. e. a division of special assistants to the descendants of Levi, originally appointed by King David; and so throughout the book; cf. Ezra 2:58; 2:70; 7:724; 8:1720.} Descendants of Ziha, Hasupha, and Tabbaoth.
Descendants of Keros, Siaha, {Cf. Neh 7:47 Sia} and Padon.
Descendants of Lebanah, Hagabah, and Akkub. {Cf. Neh 7:48 Shalmai}
Descendants of Hagab, Shalmai, and Hanan.
Descendants of Giddel, Gahar, and Reaiah.
Descendants of Rezin, Nekoda, and Gazzam.
Descendants of Uzza, Paseah, and Besai.
Descendants of Asnah, {Cf. Neh 7:52 Besai} Meunim, and Nephusim.
Descendants of Bakbuk, Hakupha, and Harhur.
Descendants of Bazluth, Mehida, and Harsha.
Descendants of Barkos, Sisera, and Temah.
Descendants of Neziah and Hatipha.
The Descendants of Solomon's Servants: Descendants of Sotai, Hassophereth, {Cf. Neh 7:57 Sophereth} and Peruda. {Cf. Neh 7:57 Perida}
Descendants of Jaalah, {Cf. Neh 7:58 Jaala} Darkon, and Giddel.
Descendants of Shephatiah, Hattil, Pochereth-hazzebaim, and Ami. {Cf. Neh 7:59 Ammon}
All of the Temple Servants and descendants of Solomon's servants numbered 392.
{Non-Documented Persons} {(Nehemiah 7:61-69)} d Here is a list of returnees from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addan, and Immer who could not prove their ancestry and lineage from Israel:
Descendants of Delaiah, Tobiah, and Nekoda: 652 {Cf. Neh 7:62 642}
Descendants of the Priests: Descendants of Habaiah, Hakkoz, {Cf. Neh 7:63 Koz} and Barzillai, who married one of the daughters of Barzillai from Gilead and took that name.
These people searched for their ancestral registrations but they couldn't be located. Accordingly, they were assigned an "unclean" status and couldn't be priests.

Governor Zerubbabel {The Heb. lacks Zerubbabel} also ruled that they shouldn't eat anything holy until a priest arose with Urim and Thummim. {I. e. a high priest to whom God would reveal his will through the jewel-encrusted breastplate that he wore; cf. Exod 28:30, Neh 7:65}
The entire assembly numbered 42360,
not including 7337 male and female servants, along with 200 {Cf. Neh 7:66 245} singing men and women.
In addition, they had 736 horses, 245 mules,
435 camels, and 6720 donkeys.

{Gifts for the Temple} {(Nehemiah 7:70-73)} d When they arrived at the Temple of the Lord in Jerusalem, some of the heads of the families contributed toward building the Temple of God on its former site.
They contributed to the treasury for this work in accordance with their ability: 61, golden drachma, 5, units {Lit. mina} of silver, and 100 priestly robes.

As a result, the priests, descendants of Levi, certain people, the singers, door-keepers, and the Temple Servants were able to settle in their original cities, with the rest of the Israelis in their cities.
